data.title: Taipei Times
data.meta_description: Bringing Taiwan to the World and the World to Taiwan
data.text:
Transport minister resigns over infidelity allegations

Minister of Transportation and Communications Li Meng-yen (李孟諺) this afternoon tendered his oral resignation following accusations of infidelity.Li issued a statement of apology after allegations arose earlier in the day that he has sustained an affair with a woman surnamed Chang (張) for a decade.In

By Wu Liang-yi and Kayleigh Madjar

Household savings in 2023 hit record high

Average annual household savings totaled NT$275,402 (US$8,601) last year, the highest in history, Directorate-General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics (DGBAS) data showed.Average disposable income per household last year was NT$1.14 million, up 2.5 percent from the year before, while the median

By Kayleigh Madjar

Ministry to invest in gender-neutral bathrooms

The Ministry of Environment today said it is to invest NT$280 million (US$8.76 million) over the next four years to double the number of gender-neutral public bathrooms nationwide.The ministry held a news conference announcing the project to increase the number of gender-neutral bathroom facilities

By Kayleigh Madjar

Cyclone to bring downpours to south, no direct impact

A new tropical storm that has formed east of Taiwan is not expected to affect the nation directly, but is forecast to bring heavy rain to the south.Tropical Storm Jongdari at 2am today became the ninth Pacific cyclone of the year, and the fifth to form from the same low-pressure system in the past t

‘Green gold’ camellia oil farms expand in Yilan

CASH CROPS: The popularity of camellia seed oil products has increased thanks to the quality of the fruit grown using eco-friendly farming methods

Camellia oil farms in the Dananao Plain (大南澳平原) in Yilan County have increased to 17.8 hectares over the past eight years as part of local efforts to promote the “green gold” sector.Camellia oil, also known as tea seed oil and “Oriental olive oil,” has become popular among Taiwanese after a tainted

Photographer wins Paris gold

Taiwanese photographer Tzeng Chin-fa (曾進發) has won one gold and two bronze prizes at the Prix de la Photographie, Paris (PX3), including a gold prize in the Press/Fashion category for his dreamy underwater wedding photography.The PX3 was founded in 2007 and has since become one of Europe’s most pres

NTUH performs its 100th ‘keyhole’ heart procedure

National Taiwan University Hospital (NTUH) has performed its 100th keyhole heart surgery, which is a safer method to treat congenital heart disease and requires less recovery time by replacing a pulmonary valve with a self-expandable valve, the hospital said on Monday last week.One out of every 3,00

Taipei publicly listing banned preschool teachers

EDUCATION: After a recent spate of child abuse cases, the city government said it would also bolster its inspection mechanisms to better protect children

The Taipei City Department of Education is publicly listing the names of preschool teachers who have been banned from working in the profession and the schools at which they had worked, as part of an effort to address a recent spate of child abuse cases.The names of the debarred teachers and the sch

Taichung probing F1 ticket scalping

City officials in Taichung yesterday said they are investigating suspected ticket scalping for an upcoming Formula One street racing event, in which ticket prices were inflated by up to 14 times.The Taichung Sports Bureau said it was maintaining close contact with organizers of the Sept. 28 Red Bull

China dispatched planes during Games

INTIMIDATION: Although China said it hoped to deliver its people’s vision of peace before the Olympics, soon after that it sent aircraft around Taiwan, the MAC said

Drills involving 304 Chinese military aircraft and 162 ships had been detected around Taiwan during the Paris Olympics, the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) said yesterday, condemning China for undermining regional peace.From July 26 to Aug. 11, a total of 304 warplanes and drones flew near Taiwan, av

FEATURE: Play about Taiwan’s diplomatic struggle tours the world

BEIJING DISTURBED: The production team said that ahead of their tour Chinese authorities had contacted Swiss officials to prevent the play from being staged

For most performers, the biggest fear about staging a new play is that no one will come. Or that an actor might forget lines. For Kuo Chia-yo (郭家佑), an activist, artist and diplomat, her biggest fear was that someone might shoot the cast.“During rehearsals, I was so stressed out that I often dreamt

Fifty young ambassadors to visit Central America

Following two weeks of training in Taipei, 50 “youth ambassadors” taking part in an annual Ministry of Foreign Affairs outreach program are to embark on a 12-day trip to diplomatic allies Belize and Guatemala this week.The 50 undergraduate students selected for the International Youth Ambassadors Ex

Ministry seeking NT$60bn quality healthcare budget

‘GREEN’ HEALTHCARE: The minister of environment encouraged executives of healthcare organizations to review their carbon footprint and reduce medical waste

The Ministry of Health and Welfare seeks to obtain a NT$60 billion (US$1.86 billion) budget for next year to preserve the quality of the nation’s healthcare, Minister of Health and Welfare Chiu Tai-yuan (邱泰源) said yesterday.Chiu made the remarks at the Ministry of Environment, which was cohosting wi
